item.title: About Georgia
item.description: What I do at the Turing I joined the Turing Institute for a 2-year contract, based in Kirstie’s lab, working on participatory science, sensory processing, and autism. My research interests include data ethics and the philosophy of technology. I’m currently building a citizen science platform and developing a participatory science framework. Before joining the Turing I was a civil servant, and I studied English literature for my undergrad and M.Phil degrees.
